pages.title: Hazardous Materials
pages.text: Some ores and dusts are hazardous and can cause negative effects or even kill you if they are carried in your inventory.$(br2)Certain equipment such as $(thing)masks$(), $(thing)gloves$(), and $(thing)hazardous material suits$() later on can be used to counter these effects.

pages.title: Face Mask
pages.text: The $(thing)Face Mask$() provides protection from any $(item)Inhalation$() hazards, such as Arsenicosis.

pages.title: Rubber gloves
pages.text: Rubber gloves can either be made from $(l:mechanics/leather_making)Leather$() and $(l:arborfirmacraft/making_rubber)Latex$(), or out of Rubber Sheets. They provide protection from any $(item)Skin Contact$() hazards, such as Berylliosis.
First, knap the leather into mittens.
Mittens are then soaked in $(thing)Vinegar$(), a mixture of fruit and alcohol.
Prepared leather gloves are then heated in a $(thing)vat$() with $(thing)Vulcanized Latex$(), one step away from rubber.
Finally, the latex-soaked gloves are heated in an $(l:firmalife/oven)Oven$().

pages.title: Rocks
pages.text: The easiest way to prevent hazardous items from entering your inventory is to not pick them up at all.$(br)Filling your inventory with $(thing)Rocks$(), for example, will let you pick and choose which items you want to pick up, letting you deal with the hazardous ones all at once later.

pages.title: Containers
pages.text: Hazardous materials only deal damage while they are in your $(thing)inventory$(), but that doesn't apply to other containers!$(br)Hazardous materials will not deal damage while they are in another container such as a $(l:tfg_tips/inventory_management)Backpack$() or $(l:getting_started/pottery#vessel)Vessel$(). $(thing)Right-clicking$() while holding a vessel will allow direct transfer of it's contents to and from containers

pages.title: Spring Water
pages.text: Standing in $(thing)Spring Water$() will provide a slow $(thing)Regeneration$() effect.

pages.title: Aged Alcohol
pages.text: $(thing)Aged Alcohol$() will give potion buffs, some of which you might find useful.$(br2)You can drink them with a $(l:getting_started/pottery#jug)Jug$() or $(l:waterflasks/recipes)Flask$().

Aged Beer: Absorption II (20:00)$(br2)Aged Cider: Speed (5:20)$(br2)Aged Rum: Speed II (2:40)$(br2)Aged Sake: Resistance (5:20)$(br2)Aged Vodka: Resistance II (2:40)$(br2)Aged Corn Whiskey: Haste (5:20)$(br2)Aged Rye Whiskey: Haste (5:20)$(br2)Aged Whiskey: Haste II (2:40)

pages.title: Nutrition
pages.text: Eating better foods with more $(l:getting_started/food_and_water#nutrients)nutrition$() will raise your maximum HP by a significant amount.$(br2)$(l:mechanics/pot#soup)Soups$(), $(l:mechanics/sandwiches)Sandwiches$(), and $(l:mechanics/salad)Salads$() are great for this.

pages.title: Bed
pages.text: If all else fails, bringing along a bed to respawn is a good idea.$(br2)If you don't have access to $(thing)Wool$() or $(thing)String$(), you can also make a $(l:getting_started/a_place_to_sleep)Thatch Bed$().
